src: sono  hon wa omoshiroi  desu \textbf{{ka}} tsumaranai  desu \textbf{{ka}}?
trs: Is that book interesting or boring?’ (\citealt{Hinds1984}: 159f.)
Is it tomorrow that you are going to school?
Is it to school that you are going to tomorrow?
So, do you have any brothers or sisters?’ \citep[166]{Hinds1984}
Is it \textit{tonight} that (my) lord will come to me?’ (Western; \citealt{Vovin2009}: 1220, 1225)

src: yama-ni=\textbf{{ka}} ne-m-u mwo  /  yaNtör-i pa na-si-ni?
trs: Shall (I) sleep \textit{in the mountains} since there is no lodging (here)?’ (\citealt{Kupchik2011}: 834, 835)
(Is) your dog black?’\footnote{The words \textit{hoyin} ‘dog’ and \textit{qalux} ‘black’ have been borrowed from \ili{Atayal}.}
(Is) your chair heavy?’ (\citealt{Peng2015}: 52, 54, 55)\footnote{The words \textit{teykan} ‘chair’ and \textit{’suw} ‘heavy’ derive from \ili{Atayal}.}\z\z
Do (you) think (I) love the sowed water leeks so much?
From tomorrow shall (I) sleep together with the reeds?’ \citep[832]{Kupchik2011}
Wait, is (your visa valid) for one year?’ (\citealt{HayashiM2010}: 2687, simplified)
Who did you say it was?’ \citep[165]{Hinds1984}
It is a fine day, isn’t it?’ \citep[296]{Hasegawa2015}
What time did those people get here?
(I) suppose that that person is not a teacher, is that right?’ \citep[73]{Niinaga2010}
Is it Kamadee who grows mangoes?’ \citep[394]{Miyara2015}
Is it Kamadee who will grow mangoes?’ \citep[394]{Miyara2015}
Kamadee is going to grow what?’ \citep[395]{Miyara2015}
Shall we not listen to him?’ \citep[395]{Miyara2015}
Is this an island of god?
I don’t know [what I should do].’ \citep[225]{Pellard2009}
But I’m not sure [whether (the house) was behind or in front].’ (\citealt{Shimoji2011a}: 132f.)
Is this a bird or a bat?
(I wonder) is this a bird or a bat?’ \citep[397]{Lawrence2012}
What will you give to Taro?
I wonder which one will fall down?’ (\citealt{Izuyama2012}: 439, 419, 425, 444, 421)\z\z

src: anata  no  namae  wa \textbf{{nan}} desu  ka?
trs: \isi{What is your name?}’ (constructed in analogy to \ili{Yilan Creole})

\isi{What is your name?}’\footnote{This sentence was given to me by a native speaker from \isi{Taiwan} during my talk at \textit{The 8th International Conference on Construction Grammar} (\citealt{Hölzl2014b}). \ili{Chinese} also has further constructions.}
